definition: to be parted by death
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
separated in life and death/to part for ever

sentences.english: The doctor who had been used to see separation and death burst into tears at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 看惯了生离死别的医生，却在这一刻落泪了。

sentences.english: Love is like this , so is long or forever parting .
sentences.chinese: 爱情如是，生死别离如是。

sentences.english: The most unbearable pain in the world is to be parted in life, and separated by death.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最令人悲痛难忍的，莫过于生离和死别。

sentences.english: Neither shall there be sorrow or dying.
sentences.chinese: 也不再有悲伤和生离死别。

sentences.english: In a world without future, each parting of friends is a death.
sentences.chinese: 在没有未来的世界里，生离即死别。

sentences.english: How many people die from other health.

definition: separated in life and death/to part for ever
to take leave of/to leave/separation
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to part forever/eternal parting (i.e. death)
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
next of kin/closely related
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
to see one's child die before oneself
pinyin: bai2 fa4 ren2 song4 hei1 fa4 ren2

definition: to part forever/eternal parting (i.e. death)
ingrained/entrenched/deep-rooted
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
pain/suffering
to be estranged
life or death/critical (event)
